structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS

law.catch_line: Contract with county for administrative functions -- Approval of expenditures.
law.text: In order to avoid duplication of functions within the area of the district, the district shall contract with the county for the performance of administrative functions, and all expenditures proposed by the district shall be submitted to the county judge/executive for approval, subject to confirmation by the fiscal court; provided, however, that when a project has been undertaken and bonds issued after initial approval by the fiscal court as required by KRS 107.370, the board shall be required to continue any contribution which it has contracted to continue as provided in KRS 107.410, to the extent of the income and revenue provided to the board.
law.history: Amended 1976 (1st Extra. Sess.) Ky. Acts ch. 20, sec. 6, effective January 2, 1978. -- Amended 1972 Ky. Acts ch. 313, sec. 6. -- Created 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 155, sec. 17.
